title: Nifty: Volatility On September 9th May See Repetition Of August 26th
text:
On analysis of the movements of , in different time frames, I find that the closing levels of Nifty 50 on September 6th, 2019; look evident enough for upcoming volatile moves on September 9th, 2019. I find that amid growing volatility Nifty 50 may see the quantum of volatility what it had on August 26th, 2019. No doubt that the overall trend may remain in an uptrend. I find that the opening level will define the further directional moves of Nifty 50, but the frequency of changing direction will remain high due to heavy build-up of open-interest in Nifty options, which is going to expire on September 12th, may enhance the volatility before closing makes the situation very uncertain. For watching my upcoming videos on Nifty 50 and , subscribe to my YouTube channel ‘SS Analysis’

On the other hand, has been constantly facing stiff resistance at 2982, which may result in sharp sell off from the current level, as the U.S. equity markets seem pretty sure that nothing has really changed from yesterday and that Trump will get his cut at the FOMC meeting later this month. On the other hand, uncertainty over Sino-U.S. trade tussle looks still creating bearishness in global equity markets.

Finally, I conclude that the may remain bullish during the week of September 9th, 2019, despite growing quantum of volatile moves. No doubt that some of the sectoral indices may keep the bearish pressure on Nifty’s move; but overall trend will remain bullish.
